data.message: I received a message by a FB profile who claims to be an be an Online Senior Coordinator for Facebook. And went on to say I won $250,000.00. Was given a website listed below: you advise to contact the Facebook disbursement for your claim right now with this email address    Facebookdisbursement@instruction.com,facebookwinner075@gmail.com just contact them now so that they can tell you how you can get your winning. You are about to log in to the site "instruction.com" with the username "facebookdisbursement", but the website does not require authentication. This may be an attempt to trick you. Is "instruction.com" the site you want to visit?    Once I got to this message, I stopped, for I knew it somehow good be a scam. I'm pretty sure if I was a Facebook winner I'd be notified via a safe and secure website.  I'd like to know if this was a scam???

replies.message: Hey there, Betty. This sounds like spam. We recommend that you do not provide any personal or financial information to the sender and report the spam to us by following these tips: http://on.fb.me/1NQ9GH4. Thanks for helping us keep Facebook a safe place! -Jordan
I keep getting FB messages from a Mauricio Gerod Downing claiming to be a n Online Senior Coordinator. Does Facebook have an employee by this name???
This happened to me twice today

I got one last year, and I reposted it as a scam!!
Said it was FB. I called the number, recorded it, and replayed it as a .video message. They got the hint. 
It's the time of year that ALL  KINDS of people are out, begging, stealing, and lying! Smh. Ya gotta remember if it sounds too good.....,it's NOT TRUE,!
Learn to report suspicious activity FB staff are great at sorting things out. I am the master of reporting, the staff probably dislikes me but I want FB safe for all
Facebook how do i get in to this cash give away
It's a joke, like everything else
I was contacted also. Just ignore
Seriously!? Do you really have to ask if this is a scam?
This happien to me twice this week
